lead_paragraph: Conservative intellectuals fear Mr. Trump will spell the end of conservatism, while the cadre in Washington fears Mr. Cruz will build a new party machine and bypass them.

byline.contributor: Maggie Haberman and Steve Eder contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: Trump or Cruz? G.O.P. Argues Over Who Is a Greater Threat
headline.main: Donald Trump or Ted Cruz? Republicans Argue Over Who Is Greater Threat

snippet: Conservative intellectuals fear Mr. Trump will spell the end of conservatism, while the cadre in Washington fears Mr. Cruz will build a new party machine and bypass them.
abstract: Two powerful factions of Republican party are arguing over whether presidential hopefuls Donald J Trump or Sen Ted Cruz is greater threat; Trump is viewed as danger to conservatism, while Cruz is anti-establishment; divide highlights how presidential candidates' emerging political forces is imperiling party's entrenched power.
